description: Euclid-Mullin sequence (A000945) with initial value a(1)=79 instead of a(1)=2.
comments: a(5), a(7), a(9), a(14) and a(23) are all the product of the preceding terms + 1. - _Robert Price_, Jul 10 2015
links: Robert Price, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..39
mathematica: a[1]=79; a[n_] := First[ Flatten[ FactorInteger[ 1+Product[ a[ j ], {j, 1, n-1} ] ] ] ]; Array[a, 10]
prog: (PARI) spf(n)=my(f=factor(n)[1, 1]); ffirst(m)=my(v=vector(m)); v[1]=79; for(i=2, m, v[i]=spf(1+prod(j=1, i-1, v[j]))); v \\ _Anders Hellstr√∂m_, Dec 06 2015
author: _Labos Elemer_
extensions: The 23rd term is a prime of 122 digits.
